review_title: I LOVE WHAT ICT DOES FOR OUR COMMUNITY
pros: There are opportunities to grow in the business. They are willing to work with you if you want to further your education and offer really great opportunities for employees. They will cross-train you so that your opportunities for expansion are greater. If you work hard, they work with you during the harder times. They understand that life happens but if you truly work hard, they will do whatever they can to help you through it because they know you are a valuable employee. Every company has issues but ICT does great with targeting those issues quickly and taking the appropriate steps to make the college a better place to study and work.
cons: Nothing that isn't addressed in a timely manner.

job_title: CBT lab instructor  in Chamblee, GA
pros: Had a great opportunity to make an impact
cons: The software we used to grade/teach is out dated

pros: Students are interested in learning.
cons: No diversity among staff and senior management. The pay is not commensurable to staff experience and academic achievement. There is no communication among staff members due to a lack of culture. There are no incentives, rewards, or acknowledgment from senior leadership.

pros: Ability to take classes as part of compensation package
cons: Salary not in league with education and experience. Everyone thinks seniority makes them a manager, despite lack of basic English. Lacks respect for staff

pros: The chance to teach online
cons: Ownership and leadership lacks educational experience Management is based on friendship not ability to perform

pros: If you’re strong and dedicated to your students and job with dedication and compassion, you will be appreciated and respected.
cons: If you are a slacker and not willing to learn the system and process, don’t have compassion and dedication to your students and the Institution you’re not going make it here, we have tough skins, we ride through the ups and downs. The majority of our students are International, which is a great challenge each day, it takes a lot of love and patience. Shoutout to all ICT Instructors 😇🙏🏼❤️

pros: easy job and good pay
cons: has to be multi-task person. They might ask you to do what does not belong to your job

review_title: Fantastic Place to Work and Giving Back to the Community
job_title: Director of Edcuation in Houston, TX
pros: If you are truly working to help students become better citizens in our community, ICT is the right place for you. Great Mission Statement and Plan Great Working Hours Great Teachers of the Education Business Great Opportunities to work your way up in the System Great Place to utilize your skills to grow and develop personal goals
cons: Long hours Wants excellence with medium resources

review_title: A school with a great mission
pros: I work at ICT because the mission of educating a low-income population and showing them how to have a more lucrative career and life is important to me. The student always comes first here. The staff is diverse, caring, and educators at heart. They want to teach you to do the best you can.
cons: This is a high pressure, driven company. If you aren't interested in setting goals and working hard to get there, this isn't the company for you.

pros: ICT offiers a variety of positions, beleive in pronoting within, and offers fexible work schedules. Also has benefits like personal time and vacation time, paid holidays, 401K, and medical, vision, and dental insurance.
cons: Some say they pay is low for the work we do, bu I think it is reasonable.

pros: Some of the staff is great to work with. They care about the students and it shows.
cons: For a technology school they have old systems in place for starters. They go through employees like nothing. They really don't invest in thier employees so don't expect much in that area. It almost seems that the employees that can bring change to the local campus don't last long, but the ones that don't do thier job tend to be there for years.

review_title: I enjoy my co-workers and faculty at the southwest campus.
job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Houston, TX
pros: Diversity, opportunity, friendly environment, family oriented.
cons: Turn over, more teachers needed, not enough staff development, needs instrctor-led classes in Texas for occupational students, no work-study opporotunities for level 4 VESL students.

pros: This is a great place to work. I've never been a part of such a diverse, multi-cultural organization whose mission is all about the student. They try to get students the education they need as soon as they can and get them better jobs. That's what ICT is all about. The management, educators, and staff really want to help the students. Everyone pulls together for that purpose.
cons: Though they are a technical school they IT could be better.

pros: Everyone works very hard to make sure students are happy
cons: Wish all classes were on campus

review_title: Why do I work for ICT
pros: ICT cares about its employees, cares about Students, Teamwork, different cultures.
cons: Need more manpower will give employees less stress

pros: Good curriculum, staff, and work environment
cons: medium pay rate, can be a little better.

job_title: Computer Lab Assistant in Gainesville, GA
pros: friendly staff hour availability chances to grow
cons: none at all, really, really

job_title: Adjunct ESL Instructor in Gainesville, GA
pros:
- Flexible schedule
- Real opportunities to serve adult students
cons:
- Limited hours
- Lack of direction for lesson planning, etc.

pros: Great coworkers, great students, clean building, computer lab
cons: There are too many to share.

pros: Location is the only plus - right next to a MARTA Station in Chamblee
cons:
The school preys upon students who have Pell Grant funds available (or access to low income grants). They will pass any student who pays tuition even if they don't learn the course subject matter. 

In addition to being a predatory college, the work life balance for employees is simply horrible. They expect you to work every night until 7 PM with the illusion you can leave early on Friday - BUT ... they have a sales meeting every Friday at 3PM!! 

The Founder (Elmer) and President (Blair) are only there to prey upon those who cannot get into real colleges or Universities. Their only true measure of successes is money - via loans and student pell grant money.

Eventually the Accreditation board will uncover that they push high interest loans on students, (they own the finance company too) and then pass them even if they don't attend class or truly pass the course. 

They belittle admission reps weekly... it's the most uninspiring management team I have ever encountered

Benefits are very expensive and 401K doesn't kick in until you have been there a year. (Talk about caring and investing in your people!!)

review_title: The student's successful outcome is the goal
pros: I have worked for Interactive College of Technology for 25 years. The main thing I like is that I am held responsible for the outcome of the student’s success in my department. My career started at ICT in the late 80s and in 1998 I left for a larger private school based out of New York. The money was fantastic but after a decade I realized that school did not care about their student’s success or outcomes. The students were only a revenue number. I returned to ICT in 2007 and it was one of the best business decisions I have ever made. I have read some of the reviews and I ask myself did we work at the same place. I did not get into education to become rich, I did it to enrich my soul by helping people.
cons: There are no cons when you help people achieve their dream careers!

pros: I've been working and teaching here for almost 6 years and I have built great working relationships with my colleagues and managers. I love my students and I love being able to have the freedom to create a dynamic classroom for my students. This has been one of the best jobs I've ever had when it comes to work environment and relationships.
cons: As an instructor here, you have to be prepared to really manage your income because it is very inconsistent. Also, if you are coming into this position part-time, it is best that you already have a full-time position.

pros: Cool to interact with students
cons: The management was a little unstable.

job_title: Employment Assistance Coordinator in Gainesville, GA
pros:
ICT provides great resources to a diverse community of learners. Immigrants to the US can learn English (on-line or in the classroom) with enthusiastic instructors. 
We encourage our VESL students to continue their education and pursue their Associates degree. Our small class sizes and caring instructors can offer individualized attention to the non-traditional student.
cons:
Due to offering flexible schedules for our non-traditional students, It may be difficult for some instructors to work split-shifts
 (classes 9am-1pm & 6pm-10pm)

job_title: Director of Education in Morrow, GA
pros: We have an amazing faculty and staff ready to assist students with the best possible education to prepare them for the professional goals they plan on achieving.
cons: Not enough students know about our amazing programs and how these programs can help them become better in the areas we offer and they might need.

review_title: The best company to work at
pros:
The leadership is honest, approachable and fair.
There is room for growth. 
There is open collaboration between everyone. 
There is constructive feedback.
The Team work!!!
cons: It's hard to leave the company.

pros: no pros. worst job ever. low pay. basic and overpriced benefits. incompetent leaders. 10 years behind on technology.
cons: too many cons. low pay. dated technology slows down workflow. leaders hire people who don't even know how to use email and calendars properly. and when they finally do find workers who are competent, they treat them worse than stray dogs. all senior leaders are white men, while the lowest ranking workers are of color. this is how they claim to be a diverse organization.

review_title: Interactive College of Technology is a fantastic place to work!
pros: It is amazing going to work every day knowing I made a difference in a student's life. It is also fantastic working with people who care, who listen to your opinion, and do all they can to make your work environment the best it can be.
cons: Working a split shift is challenging to get used to.

pros: Staff is supportive and helpful. ICT has a very friendly work environment that quickly makes you feel like part of a family. Everyone is willing to help each other for the better good of the students. Students are all amazing and hard working. I am so grateful to have found ICT!
cons: I have never had a negative experience working for ICT.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Manchester City Centre, England
pros: From the hiring process through your time teaching at ICT you will have endless support. The staff at this small location care about their students and inspire students to learn English.
cons: Each course is 5 weeks and I wish they were longer but overall, ICT has an excellent structure for their students.

pros: ICT engages in professionalism and extends respect to employees and students. I believe the ambience promotes educational goals for students. It’s an exciting and rewarding place to work.
cons: Pending updated water fountain with filtered water option

job_title: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) in Chamblee, GA
pros: Long History, Quality Programs at reasonable tuition rates. Long term caring employees
cons: Heavily regulated industry with a lot of complexities

pros: Teamwork, opportunity to learn, Good distribution of work hours
cons: Needs to work in a way to simplify a few process.

pros:
Appropriate facilities with modern technology.
Pleasant work environment.
Highly trained staff.
cons: I do not find any disadvantage so far.

review_title: Run, don't walk, away from this place.
pros: Truthfully, there is nothing beneficial to working at this place.
cons: This is the worst, and I do mean worst job I have ever taken. When interviewing and beginning, everything seems professional and business as usual. However, once you are past the initial training, everything changes. Immediately you are expected and demanded to bring in countless students and enroll them the same day you meet with them. Take into account that you are expected to produce your own "leads" or people gullible enough to come in and sign up. The list of names and numbers they give you are not even those who have ever heard of the school, they're from a paid marketing list. If feeling like a sleezy salesman for a less than subpar school is for you, then you will do well. Everyone is a one man show, doing anything and everything to make themselves look good and you look terrible. People are nice to you when you are talking face to face, but thanks to the paper thin walls, it's not hard to figure out what is being said behind your back. More times than not, it's untruthful. The tuition for this school is priced as though it offers a genuine bachelor's degree program, but it's certificates and an associates from a school that's been around for decades, but still no one knows about it. For good reason. The students they recruit are people who have never gone to college before or did not do well in school the first time around. It's more like preying upon vulnerable people who are about to sign up for thousands of dollars of student debt to work at a dead end job because the classes are taught by teachers who show up hung over from the night before. It's a joke. The management is unprofessional. There is no growth or development at this place. There is no support from anyone, because everyone is too busy watching their own back. The president is uninspiring at best, though morally corrupt and a bully at worst. The hours are long and every Friday you are called into a virtual meeting to sit around and hear about how much you suck at your job and it's all your fault that you suck. Prepare yourself for an unmotivating, lengthy, unprofessional speech from the president on how things should be done and there are no excuses to why people aren't lining up at your door each day to sign up for this "school."

pros:
Helping students achieve career and education goals
Practicing communication skills daily
Great atmosphere, great coworkers
Easy to sell the benefits of the programs
cons: Tough to get leads sometimes

review_title: Great experience with little prior knowledge required
pros:
- Reasonable pay
- Flexible hours
- Relational/service oriented work
cons:
- Limited hours
- Limited in-person instruction due to COVID

pros: Teamwork, great work environment, supportive and helpful colleagues and administrators
cons: None at this time thanks

job_title: English As A Second Language Teacher in Houston, TX
pros: Cultural diversity as well as creative freedom.
cons: Lack of professional ESL development

pros: Once of the worst working place which I've ever seen.
cons: Nothing, nothing and nothing. I would not recommend to anybody.

pros: collaborative effort to do well
cons: need more community events yearly

pros: Compliant; cost effective for students; outcome driven; compensation
cons: not for those who do not like to work.

pros: Decent starting salary, at least if you've never worked in this kind of job before.
cons: Really terrible campus. Management is super sketchy and cuts corners constantly to "enroll" students. Your job is essentially lying to low income people to get them to take classes that won't transfer to any 4 year university or community college. Cold calling all day. Turnover is insane. A super sleezy sales job. Nothing redeemable about the product whatsoever either. You have to be totally brainwashed by ICT and have rose colored glasses about technical schools to do well at this job.

pros: Great people to work with and good hours
cons: None that I know of

pros:
Easy and straightforward place to teach English to international students. The Morrow campus staff are always there to help and guide new teachers. The curriculum is uncomplicated and all the materials and instruction guidelines are provided. There are mentor teachers and supervisors that are available to assist and accommodate your needs. A great and welcoming environment for new teachers. 

Directors and supervisors at the Morrow campus are supportive and ready to accommodate teachers and students. There is no pressure or illogical demands from the supervisors as long as teachers are on time, prepared and professional.  

Retention rate, school curriculum, teachers’ opinions and suggestions etc. are all considered during faculty meeting to ensure the school and students’ wellbeing. During my time at ICT, I have never correlated my employment contingent upon students’ retention. Again, if teachers are prepared, on time and professional, teachers should not worry about their employment. Supervisors are understandable that some students may leave ICT due to personal reasons and will be in communication with teachers and staff that a potential student may be leaving. However, this is only to relay students’ status and not due to teachers’ employment. 

Overall, I enjoyed my time at ICT. The support and encouragement I have received there will not be forgotten. I highly recommend ICT a place to teach and learn.
cons:
There may be occasional faculty meetings that are unpaid. However, I would take this time to share concerns or suggestions as a team rather than being upset for the 10 minutes that we are unpaid for. 

Materials and lesson plans can be scarce at times. Yet, as a teacher I would suggest using your own personal creativity or asking other senior teachers for additional materials.

pros: great academic team, advisors and professors
cons: not so great administrative team

pros: Work Life Balance is the only pro. It has an International staff. Coworkers are very friendly. Teaching students from multicultural backgrounds,
cons:
The students can be demanding at times. Teachers are under paid. ICT is raggedy and nasty. Much needed  care and concern should be given to the Instructors and students 
The bathroom floors have urine pooled around the toilets and your pants edges get wet. 
Do not give give Christmas gifts or bonus to the teaching staff, probably because of the revolving door. 
Instructors work on December 23rd and 24th  and November 23rd and 24th which is ridiculous. 
I do not recommend working for this company. The school is more concerned about the money they can scam from FA and students other than the education.
Overall ICT has:
low pay, 
long/split shifts
no advancement opportunity
no investment in campuses, no training, poor work ethics, terrible benefits, misleading info upon hire.

pros: Some students are actually trying. Most are skating by. The students that care are the only redeeming quality. The teachers are heavily disgruntled and have every reason to be.
cons:
Where should I start? The teachers are caught between a rock and hard place. Since their pay is based upon their retention rates, they have to choose between compromising their own academic integrity or losing money. The pay is so low that they have no choice to pass unqualified students or they risk not paying their bills(most teachers have two jobs). Many of the students are simply there to get an easy visa to stay in the country. They show up once, sign a piece of paper and then never return to class. The teachers are held liable for these students, who often go AWOL and then the teachers are chastised by management for not keeping their retention numbers up when the students has no grades. 

Students get roped into loans they don't understand. The recruiting office is cut-throat and gets the students to sign agreements without fully understanding them. Teachers are often left having to deal with angered students who realize they've been cheated and trapped.

pros: You are able to grow within the company, eligible for a raise at 90 day review, vacation, holiday pay, mon-fri schedule.
cons: Was brought on as a admissions rep. not even a week into the job the senior rep was trying to run everyone off. we received no formal training, were given training manuals, training videos and 1 -2 year old leads and sent on our way. the senior rep of 5 years then resigned and the pressure was placed on us, still working with old leads we were being asked to covert what the senior rep had been converting with brand new leads. A week after finally receiving good leads two of us were called into the directors office being told we would be let go because we weren't enrolling people. (it was told to one of us that they were too nice. Since this was a salary job with no commission in unsure why we were let go due to not meeting sales quotas but i dont understand how you expect someone to succeed if at the moment they are given the tools you take their job.

pros: The owners is not as bad of a person as people say. He just wants his company to succeed.
cons:
Where do I begin...

1.the owner and V.P do not market and promote the Texas main campus at all. 
2. Knowbody knows about the school
3. The have unrealistic expectations for the Texas main campus BECAUSE they do not provide you with the necessary tools in order to be a successful admissions representative.
4. They are the textbook definition of insane. They think by replacing the reps over and over, eventually they are going to hit gold. That will never happen if the owner and V.P never put money behing there product.
5. The pressure is unbelievable.
6.Since they do not provide you with quality leads, you are forced to go out into the street and solicite, which could possibly lead to your arrest.
7. Every good idea I presented to them they shot down (of course they would they are cheap).
8.no diversity in the Pasadena campus (never will be since they are located in the middle of Mexico with no public transit).
9. They offer a product to a community that knowbody wants.
10. Ill stop for now.

review_title: I love my job, our mission, our purpose my team & my students!
pros: Good pay for hard work! I have been the Director of the Gainesville GA campus for many years. Our vocational ESL and occupational programs are one of the best in the country. The dedication of my team is second to none as our main focus is OUR STUDENTS! ICT offers competitive wages, a solid benefits package and growth opportunities for those who earn it. My campus has such a welcoming atmosphere and enthusiasm from the moment anyone comes in the door, from students to visitors, to employees to vendors. I am so proud to be part of this team. Anyone that comes to ICT to work must be ready to work, we don't play around and less than excellence and total dedication to our mission is required in every department. Those who are not capable or willing to be THE BEST will drive themselves away. We have the right tools and those of us who use them, enjoy our work with ICT for many many years.
cons: I have no negative comments about the company who gives me the opportunity to do something so meaningful.

pros: A great place to learn about ESL program management and how to solve problems with few tools and supplies. Also the best place in Atlanta to have consistent contact with a diverse immigrant community.
cons: Senior management is firmly resting in senility and often reprimands via emails in ALL CAPS. There is no sincere encouragement - just sleazy and manipulative. This company knows very little in the way of support to employees. If you are lucky to work under a good supervisor, you will get it but they have few resources to do this with. Upper management at Chamblee has very poor communication with the academic team and support/guidance from upper to middle management is lacking. The various departments in the Chamblee campus constantly function at odds with each other because certain people love the power they think they have and they use it to push other team members around. Again no support for combating this. Upper management and corporate makes (not earns) upwards of four times as much as middle management positions (their direct reports). The disparity is shocking and sad. When orders for dry erase markers for teachers are threatened but upper management is making double 6-figure salaries, you know you're in a place that doesn't care about its employees.

review_title: Started Out Well and slowly went downhill....
pros: I had a week of training, which taught me about the company, expectations, my role and how to complete my job (but trainer that I had no longer works there...)
cons: Started out as a salaried employee, then at the beginning of the year all admissions associates regardless of educational background got cut to hourly. The leads that were given were not always workable, because some were looking for programs that weren't offered (VERY limited programs available), were looking for a job instead of education or once they came in to get more information about our programs shared they had apprehension about the cost (this college is a private, FOR PROFIT school). Also, I was told in my last month of working there that I needed to reduce my hours to part time, because I wasn't hitting my numbers (number of appointments set, people coming in the door and enrollments) so they cut me to part time, yet still wanted me to continue to get enrollments. That was near impossible, because during a 20 hour work week, I had to continue to make numerous calls (generally a page long) during my short work day, and try to meet with prospective students during that short window of time.

pros: I have been with ICT for over three years teaching ESL to levels 102, 203, 204. The most rewarding experience I have is seeing the results of our students succeed, the program is well designed and geared to not only provide an educational format but teach a life lesson as well. ICT prepares our staff with knowledge to help every student achieve their goals and obtain the highest standards in earning an above average education. Our direction as staff is guided by an outstanding director who has given us the tools we need to be our very best not only as teachers but advisors and mentors. Teaching here has been the a high point of my career and given me the the strengths I need to grow as an instructor and person. The relationship I have with my students is a vital part of my career here at ICT College.
cons: I have no concerns with about the Company

pros: ICT is a wonderful place to work and is an excellent place for potential students to come learn English!  During my four years here at ICT, I have had the pleasure of and the noble task of helping people to improve their English skills in order to achieve whatever their personal goals may be (typically work related).  The classrooms are engaging and interactive.  The teachers are knowledgeable and care about the students' success.  As an employee, I get the support I need from an administration that cares about me and acknowledges my accomplishments.  The campus is conveniently located (across the street from a Marta station).  If you want to learn English or if you have a passion to teach English, come to ICT!!
cons: There are no negative comments that I have about this place.

pros: I would say the attitude of the ESL students, but their victimization by an unscrupulous, greedy, amoral, sociopathic, unethical, ignorant, insipid , and painfully pretentious administration won't allow me to note any positive aspect of this "school" whose marketing department outnumbers teaching staff.
cons:
The bulk of their revenue comes from unsuspecting ESL students who don't know they are paying tuition for something they could get for free from various legitimate tech schools in the metro Atlanta area.
The unfortunate few students who actually matriculate and register for "technical" course work, are placed in a classroom with an "instructor" who is more a proctor since the students are sold text books which they open and begin studying on their own as though in some correspondence class in the 60's. They can ask questions if they don't understand what they are studying, but the person/proctor may or may not know about the subject matter and many times just bs through the answer. The students are better off just buying and reading the textbook on their own.

pros:
Campus Director and Education Director recognize employees, take into consideration faculty ideas, remember birthdays for every faculty member, and work as hard as their employees.These directors are not at their desk all day, they are moving,advising, handling issues, hearing issues and etc.
The institution is small, so we all get along and know one another which is great because we all do our job well and don't slack.
It's an honest living.
cons:
For ESL instructors, the down side is they have two jobs- teaching and retention.If your retention is low, most likely the institution won't renew your contract.
For Lab instructors, they have to overlook many classes. 
Many students don't speak English which is challenging, but the staff at ICT for the most part are bilingual.
Admissions department has long hours. 
Only employees with 40 hours can qualify for benefits.

pros: The students. These people are salt-of-the-earth. Immigrants and refugees who are trying to make a better life for their families.
cons: Too many to count. This place bleeds their overworked students dry, and underpays the staff. I actually had to audit my paychecks and hours and found money missing. The administration did their own audit and found the same discrepancies. I was paid, but who else has been consistently underpaid? That is a big problem. The environment is toxic; I mean this in both the literal and figurative sense. Rat droppings on the floor, chemical coating on the floors that make it hard to breath-it even RAINED in multiple classrooms on more than one occasion (i.e., holes in the ceilings). The president is Satan in a suit, I swear. He needs to be investigated. I never met an employee who was happily employed here. Do not believe these positive reviews. I sat in a meeting where the president instructed employees to write positive reviews so that he could boost his Glassdoor ratings.

review_title: I can't imagine a better place on earth
pros: I worked there for 6 happy years. The president of the school always reminded at our meetings that we were there for our students and they always came first. Teachers, managers, and  admissions  are all excellent, qualified, ethical, and most of all love their jobs at ICT because they are treated fair. I miss every day of my working there.
cons: In my six years of my employment, I have never encountered any problems. I was always supported and appreciated both emotionally and financially.

pros: Currently i am in the work study program at the Newport Campus. And i absolutely love my position. I work in the Admin office .  Everyone here works as a team almost as if its a family here and i love it.  I take my classes in the morning and i work my 4 hr shift in the evening and it works out perfectly. And also ill throw in working with an awesome staff makes it even better
cons: I have been here for quite some time and i do not have a con. Flexible hours great staff seriously what more can you ask for

review_title: Bilingual Admission A.K.A. Cold Calling Sales in Pasadena Tx
job_title: Admissions Representative Bilingual in Pasadena, TX
pros: It was easy to get the job. All it look was two interviews and a drug test. They paid pretty well.
cons: The job says admission ms but it's really a sales position. All you do is cold call people, the same people over and over. The manager isn't really running the school. The main bilingual admissions lady who's been there the longest is really running the show, not in a good way. Every Friday you have a meeting with all the schools, where the owner tells the sales people that they're doing a horrible job and doesn't allow the employees to explain why things are the way they are. Employees do not stay for long. This school truly needs to get investigated. They're taking advantage of people who don't speak English and people who want an education. I don't think other schools in the area accept their credit hours from this school.

pros: Veteran instructors offer quality lessons to students. This organization is a stepping stone.
cons: Turnover is out of control and this corrupt organization is slowly dying. Unhealthy work environment (mold/mildew, no air in summer), unrealistic expectations set by out-of-touch upper management, constant belittling from upper management, insultingly low pay rates, etc., etc. Employees are held accountable for factors completely out of their control. Finances are mismanaged. Final pay is never accurate. Employees who strive to reach corporate level are willing to step on anyone/use anyone to accomplish their own selfish goals. And for what?

review_title: I am looking for another job
pros: If there is nothing else. It is a college and as such you can meet new people and the satisfaction of helping others is the best thing that you will get. One can get that at any other college or education center but this, along with some of the other instructors is the only thing that is really worth it.
cons: Broken work hours, job performance is appreciated only by words, not by salary. Work day is split in two by a huge break which makes the to-work - from-work time about 12 hours. Management will often say how much they appreciate your performance, but your salary will stay behind all other comparable job positions from all other comparable colleges.

job_title: Employment Assistance Coordinator in Newport, KY
pros: I enjoy the work with which I am involved here at Interactive College of Technology , Newport, KY. As Employment Assistance Coordinator I help current students and prospective grads find a quality job. The campus director allows me to bring my own energy and creativity to this job while always being available for feedback and direction. Overall the campus provides an excellent atmosphere for working - and learning.
cons: Being a small campus we are not always well known in the community. The students who are here do value the personal attention a small campus provides.

pros: Interactive College of Technology is a wonderful company to work for. If I didn't think so I would have left a long time ago. I love working here and I love my students. I have also had great leaders at Interactive College of Technology such as Ms. Imeen Manahan and Mr. Gregory Weaver. They were the best leaders that I have worked with. My overall experience here is great and I love working at Interactive College of Technology because of the great support I get from the company overall.
cons: I don't have anything negative to say about Interactive College of Technology. All the years I have been working here have been a great experience.

review_title: The very best in a tough educational environment
job_title: Director of Education in Gainesville, GA
pros: ICT is very invested in bringing students to success. Our mission statement is lived through our daily operations with strong administrative support policy and guidelines. Our structure leads to employee advancement and rewards for performance. Employees are held to a high level of achievement, which enhances the student opportunity to excel. College is operated to the highest levels of integrity. Demands may be rigorously imposed but leads to retained staff and faculty who care supremely about what they do. Proper tools are available to allow faculty/staff to give their best. Unlike public education, the President/CEO demands excellence and roots out those who do not achieve in the areas that maximize student achievement. Public education tends to allow mediocrity in its faculty. ICT does not. Public education gives mediocrity to the masses. ICT gives students to instructors in manageable class sizes, allowing for individualization to student needs and learning styles. Graduation from ICT translates into success for students who take the opportunity to stay invested in their educational experience. ICT is a "tried-and-true" product of an educational environment that for the most part has gone astray of practical principles and processes. We need more of this type of educational setting in private education. Truly a breath of fresh air from the private educational companies that never prove their worth in the marketplace, succumbing to failed policies and corrupt practices. What speaks the loudest regarding ICT is the U.S. Department of Education's ranking of ICT consistently in the top 20 of two-year private colleges in the country for value to the student. Disgruntled employees come and go, but the foundational cornerstones of ICT, Quality, Service and Commitment, insure the very best educational opportunity for the student. The ICT infrastructure is sound, the accreditation is top-notch, expectations are high and the integrity is without question. Students are the winners in this setting!
cons: Admissions staff needs revised training procedures for optimum performance success

job_title: Business Office Clerk in Chamblee, GA
pros: Some very fine lower level employees, teachers, staff, and students.
cons: Upper Management faces a Title VI, Title VII pay discrimination, etc. law suit which now resides within the SCOTUS on (Writ of Cert) waiting disposition for either acceptance or rejection. Former or current employees who voice concern about discriminatory practices are not trouble makers--they are Americans and fellow workers with rights. If all students and employees were being treated equally no matter race, color, disability, or creed there would have been no need, for litigation within the federal courts. I know these facts, because the plaintiff fighting ICT, is a former employee and [HE] is someone very close to me.

job_title: ESL Admission Associate in Houston, TX
pros: Students are willing to learn if you give them the right tools.
cons: Worse job ever, favoritism is the main thing in this company. No great teachers very few...

review_title: The rewards are there, but the personal cost may be too high for some
pros: There is a very real sense from many of those "in the trenches" that they really care about the students and want to do their absolute best to help them achieve their goals. Seeing these students succeed is a fantastic feeling. There are opportunities for advancement but you have to keep your eyes and ears open for them. There were some very good people there who I am glad to have worked with and would even consider a friend.
cons:
Work/life balance is totally skewed toward the work side of the spectrum. More than likely your duties will include more than what you initially believe them to be and you will be doing yourself what would normally be done by two or three people. You *have* to be willing to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary to get the job done. Students aren't coming to class? Call them up. Students having an issue that they believe requires them to withdraw? Be prepared to help them through it. Be ready to bring your own material if you need something for a lesson and the department can't procure what you need beforehand. For some, this isn't an issue as this is exactly what they want to do. For others, it may be a non-starter.

THERE IS NO DEDICATED STUDENT RETENTION TEAM (as of the time of my review). Yes, there are "advisors" but [a] only ESL has a "team" of advisors, and [b] for occupational students the administration of the department is the advisor, which can total in some departments over a hundred students. The instructors and Department Chairs/DoE/Campus Director *is* the retention team. Instructors are reviewed on success rates and participation rates; if a student isn't coming to class, then that hurts the instructor's rates and they are impacted accordingly (this is regardless of whether or not the absences are justified). The administration can do nothing to help their instructors with this, as well. ICT is a non-attendance taking institution; instead, it runs on "participation". This means that if a student is censused, the instructor and department administration "owns the student" until the end of the semester and the student cannot be withdrawn if they stop coming to class and cut off all communication. This hurts the instructor, this hurts the administration, this hurts the student since it impacts their GPA as well as monetarily if they are receiving Title-IV, and it hurts the reputation of the school.

All the stress, pressure to achieve numbers, and duties upon duties upon duties fosters a toxic environment which isn't healthy in the long term. You need to be aware of this going in. There will be talk about things being put into action, groups being put together to achieve certain goals, and then they will just fizzle out with nothing proceeding. Repeat ad nauseum.

I don't like being negative about things, but these were the major beats. There are other small things as well. I do not have negative opinions about the CEO.

pros: The other teachers and students are great. The students are mostly hard-working blue collar workers learning English to improve their lives. Despite poor pay and job instability,  teachers are supportive of each other and other students.
cons: This is a business, not a school. Profit at any cost is the unspoken motto. The CEO isn't interested in education,  just money. Administrators happily throw teachers under the bus to save themselves.  Administrators  are also very disorganized.  New teachers are not well informed and receive virtually no training.

job_title: Media Service Coordinator/ESL Instructor in Houston, TX
pros: ICT Hillcroft Campus is an exciting place to work. I enjoy the diversity in the student body, faculty and staff. Management goes the extra mile for its students to make sure they are provided with the correct information. This will allow students to reach their potential.
cons: At ICT we provide the provide a foundation in learning the English language, but students need to understand in learning anything new you have to nurture it on a daily basis. Some students give up too easily and refuse to meet the challenge.

pros: none that I can name I guess working with people from different countrys or just getting ESL experience
cons: This company does not offer any medical benefits to any of there teachers and as of recently no longer carry full time teachers on the payroll in order to avoid paying benefits to the employees I am not sure if this is fare practice it sounds like its against the law. Also you cant have foreign students sign contracts and loans that they cannot read this school need to be on the local news

review_title: Its been a great experience working for ICT
pros: It has been a great experience working for ICT. I have been able to help many students in accomplishing their goals for a better future. The Company has been very good to me and has given me the opportunity to continue growing with them.
cons: work hours can be long at times , but the work is still rewarding.

pros: At ICT, internal promotion is always recommended. With hard work and putting our students first, you can make it far within the company. You also have opportunities to learn various jobs if willing to do the hard work. It is full of great employees who support each other.
cons: The hours can be difficult but it is an adult school with morning and evening staff.

review_title: Why is this place still opened?
pros:
Curriculum is provided, but as another reviewer mentioned it needs a lot of improvement.

The other instructors are friendly and always willing to give advice or help others.

Some managers are very encouraging and are willing to listen to concerns. ( Hence the word some as other managers are completely unapproachable and almost aloof)
cons:
ICT has a terrible reputation in Atlanta. I remember speaking to an ESL program coordinator of a local university and she compared ICT to a sweatshop when I told her about the amount of work I was expected to do in a 40/hr work week. She actually advised me to only work at ICT for a year maximum and then move on to somewhere else. Education is not the priority here and teachers are neither valued nor appreciated for their work but rather viewed as disposable. Every few months or so, teachers receive a performance evaluation in which a manager sits in and observes their class. However, having an excellent performance evaluation means little or nothing to the dean and the president as all they care about is retention and money. You can't believe anything that administration tells you. They'll tell you that you're doing a great job one day and the very next day they'll let you go. 

There is absolutely no training for new teachers. They are literally just thrown into a classroom with no idea on what block they are teaching or how to operate programs on the computer. This, in turn, makes new teachers look incompetent and unprepared. 

ICT also does a terrible job of screening students. They admit students who are probably illiterate in their own language which is completely unfair to both the teacher and the student. Moreover, managers and teachers are forced to compromise grades so that the students, even the illiterate ones, will stay and move up to the next level. Talk about a lack of moral and ethical conduct.

On top of all of this, the program is set up like a revolving door. Here's how it works: 

Each semester is made up of three 5-week sessions or "blocks" (Block A, B and C). Block A, of course, being the easiest of the semester as it covers the language basics and Block C being the hardest as it's "somewhat" a combination of everything taught in Block A and B. The school admits new students every 5 weeks, so many students do not start in Block A. Do these students have a hard time grasping the material? Absolutely. Do they constantly ask the teacher why they are not starting with basics like the ABC's? Absolutely. Are the teachers blamed when these students find the material incomprehensible and decide not to come back? Absolutely. Does the school do this solely for monetary gain? Absolutely.

Every way in which this company operates tells students and employees that the only value here is money. It should not even be considered a school because it functions like a corporate business.

pros: This company allows you to share your ideas, you have open dialogue with your immediate bosses and heads of the company. We discuss what can be changed and how it can be changed. It promotes from within and helps guide us
cons: It can be stressful in management but it is worth all of the stress when you reap the rewards.

pros: The students are grateful for their teachers. Also, you are free to instruct however you want in the classroom.
cons: Majority of the students cannot read in English so how are contracts being signed? Students receive private loans through the school and have a high interest % to pay back. Instructors are treated awful by "managers" whom are under qualified. Some managers have never taught in a classroom, or have Education degrees. It is very common to see managers step-down. I was told by a manager that she had to write positive reviews on glassdoor.com

pros: I really enjoy the atmosphere here at ICT. I love working with the students to help them achieve their goal of learning English. Everyone I work with is great!
cons: The curriculum is a little complicated for the students to follow, but they are remodeling the curriculum with great improvements.

pros: There aren't any. WORK SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!!!!!!!!!!
cons: I signed on with ICT; and I was not hired on completely I was brought on as a SUB and not as an actual Instructor as I signed up to be . I also wasn't told this so I am coming to work everyday driving halfway across town thinking I am making a particular wage but to come to find out after i receive my check a week later than I was suppose to by the way, that I was not getting the hourly rate that was on all of my paperwork. I also then go to speak to the Director about this issue and she then makes it seem like they did me a favor and gave me a job "to get you on quicker and help you out they made you a sub" honestly I have a regular job this position was just extra money and something to do during the summer . the way that things are done here are EXTREMLY unprofessional. I also was asked to do my HR paperwork off so that HR could fill in dates like what who does that, Aren't all dates and I9 and HR paperwork suppose to match i don't know maybe i missed something when i worked in HR . this place pays next to nothing and makes sure that it pulls as much work out of you as humanly possible . RUN dont work here . most the positive comments come from upper management. please find a REAL school that has a strong rigorous curriculum and that will benefit you . Students are just passed along and they aren't held accountable setting students up for failure in the real world and at a real learning institution .

pros: Curriculum is set and lessons are made for you.
cons:
Retention based reviews.
The owner is very aggressive and disconnected from what the teachers go through.
Little pay for the amount of paperwork we have to do.
High teacher turnover so it is difficult to get to know your coworkers.

pros: This is a company that strives for success and clearly puts students first.  We offer our delivery of education in a unique manner. The staff are held accountable to follow strict policies and procedures to ensure we follow all regulatory expectations.
cons: We are in a economically challenged area and are constantly looking for additional resources for our students. Additional program offerings would be a plus.

pros: I love the individuals that I work with, everyone is a team player and works well to help everyone around them!  The student body is almost always pleasant to be around and wonderful to work with!
cons: Its really hard to think of any cons.  It is a great place to work!

pros: Well paid for the job we do. Student centered mind although of course it is a business and to give good service you need to make a profit.
cons: Some ideas are a bit old school or better said out dated. Not enough advertising to grow.

pros: Great place to work! An educational atmosphere with staff who care about the students success.  Employees are offered good pay and benefits for them and their families .
cons: Those who do not enjoy their jobs should probably be working else where.  Give the spot to some one who needs and cares about their job.

pros: 1 hour lunch, that’s about it...
cons: Terrible leads from 2012, you will be given recycled leads and expected to enroll 10+ students every start. The management is absolutely terrible. This is an HOURLY job. When I initially started they said it was SALARY. You basically slave away your life for very little pay. They will never recognize your hard work. You can be at this company for 10+ years and you’ll only get a couple of cents per raise. It’s just a terrible company over all. From owner to president to management to lead reps. They are all terrible.

pros: Ideal place to reach out to those young adult in search of a better career and knowledge in a for profit college environment.
cons:
Management leadership short sighted and negative culture for employees' growth and satisfaction.
Poor management of students SSN and private information.
Questionable student loan practices.

review_title: Success is not just the owner's responsibility
pros: Training is awesome, people focused on student success, if you have a good wok ethic you will do well working here
cons: They seem to keep employees that should maybe be doing some other kind of work

job_title: Financial Aid Planner in Chamblee, GA
pros: Top management listens to any concerns you might have. Working here more than two years. The most amazing thing about this place is that it not only makes you feel like a special employee but also feels a family member also there are great seniors to guide you.
cons: None. I always want to be a part of this college

pros: Hard work pays off at ICT! Great benefits plan, leadership is behind you 100%. Room for talent to grow.
cons: You have to work hard, be dedicated to getting better Every Day and be willing to overachieve and not wait for it to be handed to you- maybe this is a con for some.

cons: Advertise more! You have great programs to offer...more people need to know about the college. Maybe a different location would help as well.
